metadata.synopsis: A pianist (Catherine McLeod) spurns her maestro (Philip Dorn) at Carnegie Hall in the middle of Rachmaninoff's Second Piano Concerto.

reviews: Here's a musical drama in the wholesome Deanna Durbin format but with the clandestine erotic charge of King Vidor
The film is redeemed, finally, through the sheer, crazy belief in romance that Frank Borzage imbues in the film as it goes on.
